title: Nutritionist Training Program Utilizing Online Problem-Based Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Comprehension of core concepts and intermediate-level application skills
context.additional_context: Focused on adapting to the post-COVID-19 online learning environment and cultivating problem-solving competencies required for actual dietitian roles, integrating social interaction, cognitive engagement, and instructional support based on the Community of Inquiry (CoI) framework

learning_goals: Analyzing real-world clinical and public health cases to develop personalized meal plans for addressing nutrient deficiency issues.

Using online collaboration tools like Slack or Microsoft Teams, learners will engage in real-time/asynchronous communication with peers and instructors at least twice weekly, propose two or more interdisciplinary problem-solving solutions integrating three or more academic fields (e.g., engineering, arts, social sciences), and achieve over 80% satisfaction in peer reviews and instructor feedback
Designing and implementing community nutrition improvement projects by applying evidence-based practice (EBP).
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
